result.execSummary:
The defendant Kari A. Knauf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kari A. Knauf is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kari A. Knauf was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:21 p.m. Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf266, 14cf196, 15cf66.  In 14cf266 State moves to amend count 2 to Misdemeanor Bail Jumping  - 946.49(1)(a); in 14cf196 State moves to dismiss Counts 2, 3, 4 but read in for sentencing; in 15cf66 State moves to dismiss all counts but read in for sentencing - Granted. Plea questionaire filed.  Defendant pleads   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Hogan/Court statements to sentencing.
Court Sentence
14cf196
WHS/POP 3 yrs
Jail credit - 1 day
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Community Service - 100 hours
AODA Assessement
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
14cf266
Counts 1 and 3 - CC to 14cf196
WHS/POP 2yrs
CC/Supervision Fees
AODA Assessment
Community Service - 100 hours
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Count 2
Court Costs - $243.00 - to be collected through probation as a courtesy in case 14cf266
Jail - 120 days w/Huber for all purposes to commence on/before Friday, September 11, 2015 at 4:00 p.m.
Appeal rights given
Adj. 3:38 p.m.

2:19 p.m. Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF266/15CF66. Hogan in receipt of complaint in 15CF66. Hogan statement-- has been working with Asst. D.A. Bednar-Clemens; makes motion to dismiss/lack of probable cause. Court statement--takes motion to dismiss under advisement. Per Court, no bond required in 15CF66.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

03:33 pm - Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Continuance of motion hearing held January 8, 2015.  State recalls RPD Officer Benjamin Curtes/Sworn/Direct by Bednar/Court questions witness/Cross by Hogan.  State calls RPD Officer Kyle Parish/Sworn/Direct by Bednar/Cross by Hogan.  Court denies motion.  In case 14cf266 - Hogan requests pretrial conference for this case as well.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

11:08 am - Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cf196 and 14cf266 (Initial).  In case 14cf266 - Hogan only appeared at Initial Appearance.  In case 14cf196 - Motion to Suppress.  State calls RPD Officer Benjamin Curtes/Sworn/Direct by Bednar - State submits to Court Exhibit 1 (Written Warning issued by Officer to Shane Knight)-Rec'd/Cross by Hogan/Court questions witness.  State calls RPD Sgt Angela Mertz/Sworn/Direct by Bednar/Court questions witness/Cross by Hogan.  Hogan recalls RPD Officer Curtes/Remains under oath/Hogan/Court/Bednar questions witness.  Hogan/Bednar statement to motion.  Court requests adjournment until testimony is heard from Officer Parish.  No objection from Bednar/Hogan.  Hogan statement to obtaining copies of recordings from stop - to date, this discovery has not been rec'd.  Pretrial Conference set for January 20, 2015 at 2:00 p.m. is removed from the calendar.  Bail continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

03:30 pm - Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hogan - In receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Intends to file motion to suppress.  Motion to be filed by defense within 10 days from today's date.  Bail continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:34
State calls Officer Kyle Parish/sworn/direct- witness IDs defendant/Cross by Hogan 
Court finds probable cause exists and binds over -
Bail continued  Arraignment scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:52 pm - Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.

02:36 pm - Defendant Kari A. Knauf in court.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek statement to bail - Court continues $500 cash bond set and posted.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
